page.title: 19Ecology
page.content: {Harbottle Crag Nature Reserve This area around and below the Drakes-Stone was taken over as Nature Reserve by the Northumberlan Wildlife Trust in the 1970's.Previously it had been grazed by sheep and managed as a Grouse Moor by regular burning of th heather. There is now a Nature Trail marked out with leaflets. A car park was formed by the Forestry Commission. There is also an Information Office run by the Northumberland National Park in which most of our area lies. Th Drake Stone has legends told about it,and ther are signs of an old industry around it-millstone making. Parts can still be seen to the west of the area and the holes left where they have been cut from.
